text: today on the caucus Michael shear on
what's left of the newt gingrich for
president campaign also jim rutenberg
previews the release of thousands of
pages of Sarah Palin's emails from her
time as governor of Alaska a major
shake-up in the 2012 Republican
contenders for president it's hard to
overstate how big a deal it is what
happened to Newt Gingrich on Thursday
essentially he had his campaign staff
fire him what is going on with newt
gingrich's campaign well I mean it's
simply put it's it's imploded that the
in a coordinated fashion members of his
paid members of his staff in multiple
states New Hampshire Iowa South Carolina
all decided and masked that they were
going to quit this was some of his
longest serving aids one fellow by the
name of Rick Tyler had been his
spokesperson for literally years and
when I talked to him on Thursday he said
we just had a parting of the ways we had
had determined as a staff that we knew
what had to be done for Newt Gingrich to
become president were to win the
nomination at least but they didn't see
Newt Gingrich actually following that
path mr. Gingrich and his wife had been
out on a two-week vacation on a cruise
in Greece and so the staff said they
looked at this whole situation and
thought well if the candidates not going
to do what we want him to do then then
there's no point in continuing and so
we're already looking for the aftermath
and already we've seen one of his key
supporters former governor of Georgia
where Newt Gingrich's from sonny Perdue
has already said he's abandoning mr.
gingrich's campaign and it signed on
with tim pawlenty I asked Sonny to
consider this at the right time in the
right place and I think he decided in
light of where newts campaign may be at
that this was a good time to do and
we're proud to have him one question in
the aftermath is what happens next who
does this open the door for there's lots
of rumors out there still about more
Republicans getting in possibly Rudy
Giuliani the former mayor of New York
City who ran in 2008 has been thinking
about possibly jumping into the field
as has Rick Perry the governor of Texas
who has said in the past that he's not
going to run for president but
increasingly looks like he might do so
one indication of that is that some of
the aides that resigned from newt
gingrich's campaign on Thursday are also
close to mr. Perry and and if they
decide to join up with with mr. Perry
again it could be an indication that he
really is serious about the race which
still then leaves the question of what
happens to Newt Gingrich will he
continue mr. Gingrich himself has said
that he doesn't need all of that fancy
Washington consultants and the political
consultants that normally surround a
candidate during a campaign on his
website in a statement mr. Gingrich
vowed to continue his campaign saying
that the campaign begins anew on Sunday
in Los Angeles he says that he'll run
the campaign the way he wants to well I
am calling here from Juneau Alaska
awaiting a relief of some 24,000 emails
of sarah palin's when she was here
serving out not quite a full term all
the emails from the beginning of her
term through September 30th 2008 I think
it's a testament to the fascination
factor of former governor Palin that
there are literally dozens of us here
waiting for a cache of documents and we
have no idea what their contents are we
assume it will fill in some blanks in
terms of her times combative
relationships with the oil companies her
efforts to get an oil pipeline here her
involvement or lack thereof in the
scandal here known as supergate in which
she and her husband Todd were accused of
pressuring the state troopers to fire a
man who happened to be the ex-husband of
her sister and you know very for the
very hyper local local issues that could
have national residents if she indeed
moves forward with the presidential run
you know in a way the release of these
documents is akin to the bus tour the
Chandra took a couple of weeks ago where
there seems to be some delight and
making it as difficult as possible for
what she terms the lamestream media we
are getting literally six boxes of paper
heavy paper we're going to be discussed
furiously going through them and feeding
them into scanners so that we can get
this stuff into a database a new element
that a lot of the media are doing this
time around is to invite readers to help
in the process so what we're hoping as
we put them online that inform readers
will sift through them and look for
anything that may be interesting or you
know or really newsworthy Sarah Palin so
whatever it is right now is certainly
will be interesting
